abstract: OGX is essentially a start-up, but it could prove a cheaper bet than Petrobras in Brazil’s oil sector, minus the government meddling.
snippet: OGX is essentially a start-up, but it could prove a cheaper bet than Petrobras in Brazil’s oil sector, minus the government meddling.
lead_paragraph: Eike Batista may soon be adding billions to his bank balance. Shares of the energy group OGX, the flagship vehicle of Mr. Batista, Brazil’s richest man, value its seven billion-odd barrels of shallow water oil reserves at about $5 apiece. That looks like a bargain against the $8.51 a barrel the government is extracting from Petrobras for deepwater crude. It’s no wonder China’s Sinopec Group and CNOOC are considering buying into OGX assets.

headline.main: An Energy Player to Reckon With
headline.print_headline:
An Energy Name
To Reckon With

byline.original: By Christopher Swann and Richard Beales
